control.ai
Class AIPlayer

java.lang.Object
  control.Player
      control.ai.AIPlayer

public class AIPlayer
extends Player

This class is the AI implementation of the Player class and the entry point for the control.ai package. All AI related tasks are initiated by this class.

See Also:
Player

See Also:
Card

play

public Suggestion play()
Includes reasoning about how to shrink the search space the most and how to formulate this as a suggestion. The basic approach is as follows: - For each kind, fetch possible solution cards from search space - Rank each of these cards - Increase rank of card each time it occurs in PlayerAssumptions CNF - Increase more if the player sits close to us - Suggest the best ranked cards of each kind This method indicates that the players turn has begun. Therefore, the player has to announce a suggestion when this method is called. The player receives the answer from the game logic via receiveAnswer

Specified by:
play in class Player
Returns:
See Also:
Player.play()

receiveSuggestion

public Card receiveSuggestion(Player questionair,
                              Suggestion suggestion)
                       throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Decide which card (if any) should be shown. Takes into account the knowledge about which cards were already shown to which players. When this method is called, the player is ask to disprove a suggestion. Returns null if the player is not able to disprove it, a hand card otherwise.

Specified by:
receiveSuggestion in class Player
Parameters:
questionair - player who announced the suggestion
suggestion - Suggestion to disprove
Returns:
null if cannot disprove or a disproving Card
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if an argument is null
See Also:
control.Player#receiveSuggestion(control.Suggestion)

receiveAnswer

public void receiveAnswer(Suggestion suggestion,
                          Card card,
                          Player answerer,
                          java.util.Set<Player> couldNotAnswer)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Feed the information gained by receiving this answer to the internal data structures. Call this method to notify the player about the outcome of his/her last announced suggestion.

Specified by:
receiveAnswer in class Player
Parameters:
suggestion - subjected suggestion
card - card which was shown by answerer
answerer - player which answered
couldNotAnswer - set of players which could not answer
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if suggestion is null
See Also:
PlayerAssumption, Player.receiveAnswer(control.Suggestion, control.Card, control.Player, java.util.Set)

observeMove

public void observeMove(Suggestion suggestion,
                        Player questionair,
                        Player answerer,
                        java.util.Set<Player> couldNotAnswer)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Feed the information gained by observing this move to the internal data structures. This method is called when a player show another player a card hidden from this player.

Specified by:
observeMove in class Player
Parameters:
suggestion - subjected suggestion
questionair - asking player
answerer - answering player
couldNotAnswer - set of players which could not answer
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if suggestion or couldNotAnswer are null
See Also:
PlayerAssumption, Player.observeMove(control.Suggestion, control.Player, control.Player, java.util.Set)
